title.narrative: F.a: Public Sector Trade Union against Gender Based Violence in Africa

description.narrative: For years, unions and working women have struggled against gender-based harassment and violence. Violence in the world of work affects mostly women, but it can also affect migrant workers or young workers, for example. The project is based on Convention No . 190 of the International Labor Organization (ILO) on ?Ending Violence and Harassment in the world of Work?, adopted in 2019. It obliges states to ensure that legislation guarantees the right to equality and non-discrimination in employment. As a result o f the project, working women in Senegal, Uganda and South Africa will be better protected against gender-based violence and harassment, and structural changes will be achieved in the workplace. ILO Convention No. 190 will be ratified and its content will b e better taken into account in collective agreements. The project will influence the legislation of the countries through campaigns. The project will also increase employees' awareness of their rights through training and negotiate clauses in collective ag reements to combat gender-based violence. The project will benefit those working in South Africa, Senegal and Uganda, especially women. The project is being implemented by Public Services International PSI, together with its affiliates in South Africa, Sen egal and Uganda. The project is supported by Finnish trade unions JHL and Tehy
